transcripts.text: So during lockdown, I've been up on the channel time and again trying to... explain to people the story of what's going on.  In 2018, 300 people came across the channel in inflatable dinghies.  Last year, the number was nearly 2,000.  This year, it's over 3,000 already, bearing in mind more people come in the August, September months when the weather's warmer, the sea's warmer.  We're on course this year for something like 7,500 people to come across the channel.  I've exposed the fact that despite giving £61 million to the French, that the French Navy actually escort the boats over the Channel.  I've proved that.  It's not disputed.  Since I've tried to get the public to understand the problems with this, the fact that over 80% of those that come are young males, generally between sort of 18 and 26 years old.  Nearly all of them have no identity papers.  They claim to come from Iran, but clearly many now come from Eritrea and goodness knows where else.  And a lot of you have been in touch with me to say that all over the country they've seen some strange things happening.  They've seen local hotels being filled up with asylum seekers, illegal immigrants, call it what you will.  And one of the first places that got in touch with me was some residents here in Bromsgrove in the West Midlands.  So I've come up today to have a look.  We're going to go to Bromsgrove Hilton to find out if it's true that 147 people who've come into the country, been put from Dover onto coaches, which are there almost every day, are going to find out whether it's true that that hotel is now full.  Now I think it probably is because You try and book a room in the Bromsgrove Hilton, have a go.  The number doesn't answer.  The booking form says that basically it's full for the rest of the year at this during the middle of the crisis.  So let's find out what's going on here in Bromsgrove.  But I promise you, whatever we see here today is but the tip of the iceberg.  So the staff there all got sacked?  Not all the staff.  I don't know where.  I think she was a chamberlain up there.  Yeah.  Yeah.  Yeah.  Must be someone working there.  Strange, isn't it?  Well, I'll get to the bottom of it.  I will.  Thank you, nice to see you.  I'm trying.  I'm trying.  Well, there we are.  What we're getting is people saying the biggest problem is that young women are a bit scared to go out because there are gangs of eight or ten and they're being wolf whistled and they're feeling uncomfortable.  That's the main thing.  We've heard other stories too, but that's the main thing.  At the moment, we seem to be getting it.  I understand the local MP, Sajid Javid, said nothing but he said to you that it would be temporary did he?  i had an email from him saying that it was tentatively arranged.  yes yes but it doesn't look very temporary because we tried to book a room and you can try for this week or next week or september and there are no rooms available.  well i'll come to visit your butchers of course.  no I, so, I did these videos about the English Channel, about all the migrant votes coming over, illegal migrant votes coming over.
